name: places/ChIJF_TwnRX2wokRmY-Iu_mkJYs
formattedAddress: USA, Columbia University, 401 W 119th St, New York, NY 10027, USA
adrFormatAddress: USA, Columbia University, 401 W 119th St, New York, NY 10027, USA

originalText.text:
Literally after living for couple years here I can’t understand any of the bad reviews. First of the rent doesn’t increase unlike rest of the city. Apts are older, but all in great condition. Any pest or other issues are fixed - one must be more persistent and carefully follow the work orders. Unlike rest of the city - Columbia feels secure! It’s safe to walk on campus without fear.
PRICE! Is great,  especially for young adults who just start off, it’s the best possible land lord in the city.
Location! It’s a great area - Central Park is just 15-20 mins walk, Trader Joe’s, Whole Foods on Columbus ave - 5-7 mins ride on the bus.
Area is pretty and cleaner than most of the city.
I truly appreciate Columbia Residential as landlord.

originalText.text: I see that there are bad reviews on here but my experience has been great. The representatives at Columbia Residential have always helped me to the extent that they can, providing me with clear information and assistance.

text.text: I see that there are bad reviews on here but my experience has been great. The representatives at Columbia Residential have always helped me to the extent that they can, providing me with clear information and assistance.

originalText.text: HORRIBLE... do not use this serve. They have no sympathy for students, or your schedule. I was almost evicted mid semester because my living situation changed, and they could not guarantee they would house me even though I had a contract with them. I have lived in Columbia Residential  housing for over a year and for the last two months of my lease my wifi no longer worked even though I bought two new routers as they suggested. I was told even though they provided my wifi for the 8 months prior, that they are not required to provide it and if it goes out it is then my problem to fix (all while during finals week).  My heat was broken and remained unfixed for a week during winter. And even after all that they are raising the rent of my apartment by over 100 dollars. As I said, DO NOT USE this service, you are better off using Columbia's off campus housing market place or StreetEasy.

As I said, DO NOT USE this service, you are better off using Columbia's off campus housing market place or StreetEasy.

originalText.text: Columbia Residential offers affordable housing in a city where it could be hard to live decently as a student. Unfortunately, the staff do not appreciate the influence they have on students' lives, and some dealings I had with Columbia Residential revealed an utter apathy and unprofessionalism. Luke, who replied to my enquiries, gave the least information possible and did not follow up when something apparently went wrong with my application. This led to the passing of an important deadline, and as a result, I missed my opportunity to apply for Columbia Housing. And when that happened, he showed no sympathy at all and tried to blame it all on the student. I do hope people working for Columbia Residential will have a slightly better appreciation of the impact they have on students' lives.

originalText.text:
Truly worst landlord in the entire city. They are your usual college housing crooks that do not care about you or your financial situation since you are students. They will hold your diploma hostage and bill you extra for additional months of rent even though you do not live in the unit anymore. No concerns at all for the stressful situation that we live in with COVID-19. Stay away by any means!
Taccara Barrier and Kwesi D. Alleyne are not helpful at all.
